instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3300: What is 820-3300? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B with No Backlight
threads.message:
Have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3300</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B with image but no backlight

Has no sings of liquid damage, already tried known good lcd

Only strange thing I have found is that pins 38, 39, and 40 have 25v when on a known good board they have 33v

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B with No Backlight
threads.message:
25V?
Thats a backlight, correct me if im wrong. 
You have the voltage there, So im assuming the screen lights up black with no display (but noticeably lighter than before its turned on?)

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B with No Backlight
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B with No Backlight
threads.message: I feel dumb but a PRAM reset brought backlight back. Thanks guys!
